accessibility.text: The shear stress is proportional to the product of the density of the water and the square of the time averaged current speed:
shear stress at the bed       density of water      time-averaged current velocity
densities of sediments and of ambient water (in practise the density contrast between particles and water)
these factors also control the rate at which particles sink, and therefore are important when considering sediment deposition

if shear stress at the bed > the frictional and gravitational forces
